Best Albums of 2015

The Music editors pick their highlights of what last year had to offer.

Album Review: David Bowie - Blackstar

David Bowie's morose, claustrophobic final studio album sits amongst his finest in a distinguished career

Album Review: Cage The Elephant - Tell Me I'm Pretty

Cage the Elephant drop dishevelled fourth album to mixed results, says Liam Dooley

David Bowie: A Reflection

By Gracie Daw

Following the death of one of music's finest ever figures, writers from across Nouse discuss their personal highlights from the illustrious career of David Bowie.

Album Review: Peter Andre - Come Fly With Me

Australian crap-pop-purveyor returns with hilarious swing album

Live Review: alt-J @ Leeds Arena

By James Bithell

As alt-J return to the Leeds Arena touring their mature second record, Kate Barlow immerses herself in the band's chilled but passionate performance

Into the Archives: Maximo Park - A Certain Trigger

By James Bithell

As the Newcastle quintet embark on their tour to mark the 10th anniversary of their debut album, James Baker looks at why it should still be remembered and enjoyed today

Album Review - EL VY: Return to the Moon

By James Bithell

Debut release from The National side-project doesn't fully live up to Liam Mullally's expectations

Album Review: Arca - Mutant

By James Bithell

Delving into the Venezuelan born producer's musical 'brainstorm', Arun Kakar explores the fragmented sound of Arca's sophomore record

Live Review: Arcane Roots, In Dynamics and Toska @ Fibbers, York, 15/11/15

Three trios blast away any remnant of Fibbers' nightclub identity with a stellar performance throughout writes Ben Phillips

Album Review: British Sea Power - Sea of Brass

British Sea Power attempt to stand out from the indie rock landscape with slightly less success than usual states Ben Phillips

Album Review: Trivium - Silence In The Snow

Ben Phillips comments on Heafy and Co.'s solid return with the culmination of several albums' worth of experimentation

Jack vs Ellie: The 1975 @ Manchester Academy 28/11/15

Nouse Music deputies Jack Davies and Ellie Langford bring a review with a twist as they lay down their differing opinions of The 1975's hometown gig

Preview: The Courteeners - Winter Wonderland

Hot on the heels of a sold-out winter tour, Manchester four-piece, The Courteeners announces new single for homelessness charity Shelter reports Jack Davies

Introducing: Highasakite

Ingrid Helene Havik of Norwegian indie-folk quintet Highasakite chats inspirations and the Norwegian music scene

Live Review: Of Monsters and Men & Highasakite @ Manchester Academy

Munisha Lall reports an a night in the Nordic wilderness with Highasakite and Of Monsters and Men.

Live Review: We Are The Ocean @ The Key Club, Leeds

Eleanor Langford reports on an incredible and intimate night spent watching We Are The Ocean

Live Review: Go West, Nik Kershaw & T'Pau @ The Grand Opera House, York

Three iconic 80s artists join together at York's Grand Opera House for an alternative and wholly unique night of nostalgia writes Katy Sandalls

Album Review: The Neighbourhood - Wiped Out!

Julia Levai reviews the dark and stormy sounds of The Neighbourhood's latest album

Live Review: BlackBox presents Maribou State @ Mansion Underground, York

There is a light at the end of the tunnel for the shit nightlife of York, according to Callum McCulloch, and it's Blackbox.

Into the Archives: My Bloody Valentine - Loveless

By James Bithell

Music Editor Ant Noonan takes a step back into the 90s and explores My Bloody Valentine's sonically revolutionary sophomore LP Loveless

Live Review: Spector @ Brudenell Social Club, Leeds

A crowd surfing Fred Macpherson gets an empty crisp packet snatched from his pocket and chips his tooth in the process, whilst four fully grown men make it on stage and have a dance with security

Live Review: Darwin Deez @ The Duchess, York

By James Bithell

Unique and unusual maverick, Darwin Deez delivers his own style of whimsy at The Duchess, York reports Emily McDonnell

Album Review: Half Moon Run - Sun Leads Me On

By James Bithell

Oddball wilderness rockers make defining strides forward with their imperfect but inspired second album, says Chris Owen

Album Review: Deerhunter - Fading Frontier

By James Bithell

As psych-garage titans Deerhunter return with their seventh installment Fading Frontier, Arun Kakar explores whether Brandon Cox's eclectic four piece have still got it

Album Review: Jonathan Jeremiah - Oh Desire

By James Bithell

Emily McDonnell sees British folk staple Jonathan Jeremiah bounce back with refreshingly soulful third album

Album Review: Stereophonics - Keep The Village Alive

Self-confessed Stereophonics fan Holly Knight reviews their new album Keep The Village Alive.

Album Review: Disclosure - Caracal

"Fast-forward to 2015 and Disclosure, are living in a world that they themselves have helped create." Arun Kakar talks on the new Disclosure album.

Album Review: Lana Del Rey - Honeymoon

By James Bithell

It is evident that Del Rey has found her niche in the industry with her fourth album as a classic, sophisticated, old Hollywood style icon, writes Emily McDonnell

Album Review: Swim Deep - Mothers

By James Bithell

The band themselves have described their second album as 'psychedelic sex music' and it's easy to see why, says Munisha Lall
